TopicTitle: Question on MechJeb 2 (can it coexist with 1.9?)

Articles.Content:
Does the 2.0 version conflict with 1.9.8 at all?

That is, can I install both, and choose which to use based on which part I add to my craft? The reason for this, is I still prefer 1.9.8 for simplicity, but want to experiment with 2.0 for some of the newer features.

Well, I looked in to it, I don't see any reason why they wouldn't as long as I only use the parts from one version.

Edited May 5, 2013 by occar
Answered own question and posted reply to self, within thirty minutes! Nice work sir/madam/Idon'tknow.

Actually, you can use both. Currently, MJ2 and MJ1 use different parts; MJ2 only gives an AR202 case, which doesn't overwrite MJ1's. Therefore, you theoretically can have both on the same vessel. Clicking on the menu-selection menu would be difficult, though.

where can you find MJ2 at?

The same place as Mechjeb 1, the mechjeb release thread. It's usually on the first page of the plugin releases forum.

Actually, you can use both. Currently, MJ2 and MJ1 use different parts; MJ2 only gives an AR202 case, which doesn't overwrite MJ1's. Therefore, you theoretically can have both on the same vessel. Clicking on the menu-selection menu would be difficult, though.

I specifically meant choose which version to use based on which version of the module I stick on the ship. I mostly wanted MJ2 for the flame-out protection on the throttle control for some high-altitude jet flying. I still prefer orbital transfers with version 1 though.

I specifically meant choose which version to use based on which version of the module I stick on the ship. I mostly wanted MJ2 for the flame-out protection on the throttle control for some high-altitude jet flying. I still prefer orbital transfers with version 1 though.

I've been watching Scott Manley's videos and I noticed that while he has both versions active he can use only one at a time if he wants to. Personally I'm only using version 1 but from the look of it you can pick which one you use at any given time.
